description: I am currently teaching CS 128 Honors at UIUC, the honors add-on course to CS128: Introduction to Computer Science II at the University of Illinois. I am developing a curriculum to teach around 120 other undergraduates about memory management, concurrency, and more in the Rust programming language. I also manage the course staff team who develop homework to accompany the curriculum.

timeline.company: Disruption Lab @ Gies College of Business
description: I am an instructor for the Disruption Lab at Gies' Incubator Program. This program aims to prepare students for careers in product management and tech consulting by teaching core technical skills and helping students discover how business and technology intersect. I am developing a curriculum to teach students in non-technical majors about the basics of Python, Bash, web development, and more. I hold weekly lectures for 16 students in the CS track of the Incubator program.
I worked on a handful of projects throughout my time at COUNTRY Financial so support the enterprise architecture, app monitoring, and contact center teams.

The main project I worked on involved designing an end-to-end system to automate authenticating callers in customer support centers using Azure Natural Language Understanding, Azure Speech-to-Text, and Cisco interactive voice response (IVR) systems. Based on initial testing, this application saved over 200 hours/week of manual customer validation. I developed a REST API with Java-based Azure Functions App and a PostgreSQL database to securely stream audio between cloud and on-premise systems and cross-check callers' spoken identifying information.
This internship was conducted remotely through NASA Ames Research Center and the Universities Space Research Association (USRA).

I aided the NASA Aeronatics Research Institute's (NARI) effort to track the effect of COVID-19 on air traffic patterns in the United States. I constructed a data pipeline to consolidate and structure data from JHU, the Opensky Network, FAA, BTS, and NASA's Sherlock Data Warehouse. I also implemented random forest machine learning algorithms to model air traffic in the US and predict air traffic patterns in the future.
This internship was conducted at NASA Ames Research Center in the Intelligent Systems Division through KBR, Inc.

I led an effort to optimize a modular drone for any task. My team and I implemented the ranking function used to select drones best suited to specified tasks. I also developed a web app allowing users to specify drone missions/tasks and to receive building instructions for the optimal drone.
As part of this internship, I co-wrote a technical conference paper for AIAA's 2020 Multidisciplinary Design Optimization Forum.

skills.name: Microsoft Azure
